column1: Noor is making coffee at a busy shop. Noor wants to make a yummy coffee with oat milk for a person. Noor picks a milk jar and puts oat milk in it. Noor wants to make coffee with almond milk. A pretty cup falls from a shelf.
column2: Does Noor think the milk jar has oat milk or almond milk?
column3: Noor thinks the milk jar has oat milk.
column4: Noor thinks the milk jar has almond milk.

column1: Zara is attending an art exhibition at a local gallery in her town. Zara wants to learn more about a particular abstract painting she admires. The label next to the artwork states that the painting is the work of a famous artist, and Zara reads the label carefully. A gallery visitor accidentally spills a glass of water near the painting. Zara observes the water spill.
column2: Does Zara believe the painting is the work of a famous artist or an emerging artist?
column3: Zara believes the painting is the work of a famous artist.
column4: Zara believes the painting is the work of an emerging artist.

column1: Carlos is a farmer in a little place, watching his corn field. He wants to give water to his plants by opening a water door connected to a river nearby. Carlos closed the water door last night. A group of big birds comes to the corn field. Carlos sees the big birds in his field.
column2: Does Carlos think the water door is closed or open?
column3: Carlos thinks the water door is still closed.
column4: Carlos thinks the water door is already open.

column1: Kofi catches fish in a little place in Ghana. He wants to catch lots of fish today for his family and to sell some. Kofi fixed his fish net last night. A group of kids start to play a ball game near the water. Kofi sees the kids playing.
column2: Does Kofi think his net is good or broken?
column3: Kofi thinks his fish net is good.
column4: Kofi thinks his fish net is broken.

column1: Ravi is a farmer in a small place in India, looking after his mango trees. Ravi wants to pick ripe mangoes to sell them. He sees a mango tree with a big branch full of ripe mangoes. A pretty bird walks through the trees, showing its pretty feathers. Ravi sees the pretty bird walking through the trees.
column2: Does Ravi think the branch has ripe mangoes or no ripe mangoes?
column3: Ravi thinks the branch has ripe mangoes.
column4: Ravi thinks the branch has no ripe mangoes.

column1: Hana is a little girl who lives in a house with a big garden. Hana wants to play with her bouncy ball in the garden. She sees her bouncy ball in the corner, shiny and round. A butterfly lands on a flower in the garden. Hana sees the butterfly land on the flower.
column2: Does Hana believe her bouncy ball is clean or dirty?
column3: Hana believes her bouncy ball is clean.
column4: Hana believes her bouncy ball is dirty.

column1: Ina is a little girl who loves playing in her backyard. She wants to play with her red ball. Ina sees her ball in the backyard, clean and shiny. A butterfly lands on a flower in the backyard. Ina sees the butterfly on the flower.
column2: Does Ina think her ball is clean or dirty?
column3: Ina believes her ball is clean.
column4: Ina believes her ball is dirty.

column1: Zara is a little girl who loves drawing. Zara wants to draw a big, beautiful tree. She sees her box of colored pencils, sharp and ready to use. A bird lands on the window sill and starts singing. Zara hears the bird singing.
column2: Does Zara believe her colored pencils are sharp or dull?
column3: Zara believes her colored pencils are sharp.
column4: Zara believes her colored pencils are dull.

column1: Xavier is in his garden, looking at his big apple tree. He wants to pick the ripe apples from the tree. The apples look red and ready to eat. A butterfly lands on a flower nearby. Xavier sees the butterfly.
column2: Does Xavier believe the apples are ripe and ready to eat or bruised?
column3: Xavier believes the apples are ripe and ready to eat.
column4: Xavier believes the apples are bruised.

column1: Vicky is a small girl in a big house. She wants to draw a picture with her blue crayon. Vicky sees her crayon box on the table, full of crayons. A bird flies into the house through an open window. Vicky sees the bird flying into the house.
column2: Does Vicky think her blue crayon is in the box or with her brother?
column3: Vicky believes her blue crayon is still in the box.
column4: Vicky believes her blue crayon is with her brother.

column1: Emma is a little girl who loves to paint. Emma wants to paint a big, pretty picture for her mom. Emma sees her paint box with all the colors. A bird lands on the window sill and starts to sing. Emma hears the bird singing.
column2: Does Emma believe her paint box has blue paint or no blue paint?
column3: Emma believes her paint box has blue paint.
column4: Emma believes her paint box has no blue paint.

column1: Tanya is playing in her room with her teddy bear. Tanya wants to have a tea party with her teddy bear. She sees her toy teapot and it is full of pretend tea. Tanya's toy cat starts to play a song. Tanya hears the toy cat playing a song.
column2: Does Tanya think the toy teapot is full of pretend tea or empty?
column3: Tanya thinks the toy teapot is full of pretend tea.
column4: Tanya thinks the toy teapot is empty.

column1: Xander is a young boy who loves to read books. Xander wants to read his favorite book about dinosaurs. He sees his book on the table, new and untouched. A cat walks past the window, chasing a butterfly. Xander sees the cat chasing the butterfly.
column2: Does Xander believe his book is untouched or wet and sticky?
column3: Xander believes his book is untouched.
column4: Xander believes his book is wet and sticky.

column1: Xander is in a park on a sunny day. Xander wants to fly his red kite high in the sky. He sees his kite lying flat on the grass. A squirrel scurries up a tree nearby. Xander sees the squirrel scurry up the tree.
column2: Does Xander believe his kite is ready to fly or is broken?
column3: Xander believes his kite is ready to fly.
column4: Xander believes his kite is broken.

column1: Walter is a young boy who likes to play with his toy truck. He wants to race his toy truck down the big hill in his backyard. Walter sees his toy truck sitting clean and ready. A butterfly lands on a flower next to Walter. Walter sees the butterfly.
column2: Does Walter believe his toy truck is clean or muddy?
column3: Walter believes his toy truck is clean.
column4: Walter believes his toy truck is muddy.

column1: Lila is in her playroom, surrounded by her toys. She wants to build a tall tower with her colorful blocks. The blocks are all neatly stacked in their box. A bird lands on the window sill and starts singing. Lila sees the bird on the window sill.
column2: Does Lila believe the blocks are neatly stacked in the box or scattered on the floor?
column3: Lila believes the blocks are neatly stacked in the box.
column4: Lila believes the blocks are scattered on the floor.

column1: Toby is at the beach, building a big sandcastle. Toby wants to finish his sandcastle before the sun sets. The sandcastle has tall towers and strong walls. A seagull flies over Toby's head. Toby sees the seagull.
column2: Does Toby believe his sandcastle is nearly done or washed away?
column3: Toby believes his sandcastle is nearly done.
column4: Toby believes his sandcastle is washed away.

column1: Quincy is a little boy who loves to draw. He wants to draw a big, bright sun with his yellow crayon. His yellow crayon is long and sharp. A bird flies past Quincy's window. Quincy sees the bird.
column2: Does Quincy believe his yellow crayon is sharp or broken?
column3: Quincy believes his yellow crayon is sharp.
column4: Quincy believes his yellow crayon is broken.

column1: Sam is a young boy who loves playing in the park. He wants to swing on his favorite green swing. Sam sees the swing hanging still and empty. A squirrel scurries up a nearby tree. Sam sees the squirrel scurrying up the tree.
column2: Does Sam think the swing is still and empty or swinging on its own?
column3: Sam believes the swing is still and empty.
column4: Sam believes the swing is swinging on its own.

column1: Liam is a small boy who loves to play with his toy car. Liam wants to race his toy car down a big hill in the park. Liam sees his toy car, clean and shiny on his table. A butterfly lands on Liam's toy car. Liam sees the butterfly land on his toy car.
column2: Does Liam believe his toy car is clean or muddy?
column3: Liam believes his toy car is clean.
column4: Liam believes his toy car is muddy.

column1: Clara is a little girl playing with her toy box in her room. Clara wants to play with her red toy car. Clara looks at her toy box and sees the red toy car inside. A butterfly flies into Clara's room through the open window. Clara sees the butterfly flying in her room.
column2: Does Clara think her red toy car is in the toy box or with her brother?
column3: Clara thinks her red toy car is in the toy box.
column4: Clara thinks her red toy car is with her brother.

column1: Daisy is at the beach on a hot day. Daisy wants to build a big sandcastle near the water. She spots a shiny, red bucket sitting in the sand. A seagull squawks loudly overhead. Daisy hears the seagull squawk.
column2: Does Daisy believe her bucket is empty or filled with water?
column3: Daisy believes her bucket is empty.
column4: Daisy believes her bucket is filled with water.

column1: Yara is a little girl who loves her teddy bear. Yara wants to take her teddy bear to bed for a nap. She sees her teddy bear on the couch, fluffy and soft. A bird lands on the window sill, chirping a song. Yara sees the bird on the window sill.
column2: Does Yara believe her teddy bear is fluffy and soft or flat and lumpy?
column3: Yara believes her teddy bear is fluffy and soft.
column4: Yara believes her teddy bear is flat and lumpy.

column1: George is a little boy playing in the park. George wants to swing on the swing. George sees that the swing is empty. A squirrel runs across the park. George sees the squirrel running across the park.
column2: Does George believe the swing is empty or covered with leaves?
column3: George believes the swing is empty.
column4: George believes the swing is covered with leaves.

column1: Liam is a young boy who loves to draw. He wants to draw a big tree using his green crayon. Liam sees his green crayon on the table, sharp and ready. A bird lands on the window sill. Liam sees the bird on the window sill.
column2: Does Liam believe his green crayon is sharp or broken?
column3: Liam believes his green crayon is sharp.
column4: Liam believes his green crayon is broken.
